title: French power group EDF raises cost estimate for Britain's Hinkley Point C
text:
FILE PHOTO: The logo of Electricite de France SA (EDF) is pictured on the facade of a building in Paris, France, August 5, 2018. REUTERS/Regis Duvignau

PARIS (Reuters) - French state-controlled power group EDF (EDF.PA) on Wednesday raised its cost estimate for the Hinkley Point C nuclear plant in Britain.

EDF said the cost to complete Hinkley Point C was now estimated at between 21.5-22.5 billion pounds, an increase of 1.9-2.9 billion pounds from prior estimates.

EDF added that the Hinkley Point C project had successfully completed one key element, namely the nuclear island’s “common raft” for its first unit in June 2019, in line with a schedule announced in September 2016.
description: French state-controlled power group EDF on Wednesday raised its cost estimate for the Hinkley Point C nuclear plant in Britain.
